data.pageText: BCP (Business Continuity Planning) is Unigy's solution for zone-level fault-tolerance and disaster recovery. BCP can also be used for system maintenance during business hours by temporarily redirecting CDIs (turrets, Pulses, and Unigy Soft Clients) to other zones while a zone is being upgraded or repaired.

• BCP is based on the relationships between front room CDIs and backroom appliances (CCMs or ACCMs). It can be configured at the instance with overrides defined at the CDI level, and consists of a set of plans that define where the system directs CDIs when a zone is not available.
• This simulation will walk you through the steps to configure a BCP plan in the UMS.
Click View Demo to view the steps for configuring a BCP plan in the UMS.

If BCP is available for a Unigy system, the UMS (Unigy Management System) provides deployment and configuration controls. If BCP is not available, the UMS does not display BCP options. If only BCP Basic is supported, BCP Campus options are not displayed.

sound.transcript: BCP (Business Continuity Planning) is Unigy's solution for zone-level fault-tolerance and disaster recovery. BCP can also be used for system maintenance during business hours by temporarily redirecting CDIs (turrets, Pulses, and Unigy Soft Clients) to other zones while a zone is being upgraded or repaired.

BCP is based on the relationships between front room CDIs and backroom appliances (CCMs or ACCMs). It can be configured at the instance with overrides defined at the CDI level, and consists of a set of plans that define where the system directs CDIs when a zone is not available.

This simulation will walk you through the steps to configure a BCP plan in the UMS.

Click the icon to view the simulation.
